rampVoltage(startVoltage, stopVoltage, time, delay=0)[source]¶

Automated voltage ramp

Parameters:
  • startVoltage (float) – Starting Voltage
  • stopVoltage (float) – Stop Voltage
  • time (float) – Rise/Fall Time (seconds)
  • delay (float) – Time (seconds) before ramp is started

rpc_hasExclusiveAccess(connection)¶

Check if the requesting connection has exclusive access.

Returns:bool - True if requesting connection has exclusive access, False otherwise
rpc_isRunning(connection=None)¶

Check if there is an RpcServer thread running

Returns:bool - True if running, False if not running
rpc_releaseExclusiveAccess(connection)¶

Release exclusive access. If a connection does not have exclusive access, this function does nothing.

Note

This function does not have to be called explicitly, the lock will expire automatically after 60 seconds.

Returns:bool - True if lock released, False otherwise
rpc_requestExclusiveAccess(connection)¶

Request exclusive access to the target object from the RPC interface. This acts as a lock on the target object, and no other connections can call functions.

Note

Exclusive Access locks expire after 60 seconds, and must be renewed by another call to RpcBase.rpc_requestExclusiveAccess()

Returns:bool - True if exclusive lock granted, False if denied
rpc_restart(connection=None)¶

Stops and restarts a running RpcServer thread

rpc_start(connection=None, port=None)¶

Spawns an RpcServer thread to handle connections on the given port.

Parameters:port (int) – Port to bind
Returns:bool - True if the RpcServer starts successfully, False otherwise
rpc_stop(connection=None)¶

Stops a running RpcServer thread.

rpc_test(connection=None, port=None)¶

Tests if a port on the RpcServer host is being used.

Parameters:port (int) – Port to test
Returns:bool - True if the port is being used, False if it is free
rpc_uptime(connection=None)¶

Get the uptime of the RpcServer

setPulseSetup(pulseEnable, pulseWidth, delay=0.0)[source]¶

Set SMU Pulse settings

Parameters:
  • pulseEnable (bool) – Enable/Disable Pulsing
  • pulseWidth (float) – Pulse width in seconds - must be greater than 20E-6
  • delay (float) – Delay before first pulse in seconds
setSourceFixed(source, base, peak)[source]¶

Configure the SMU to output a fixed voltage or current

Parameters:
  • source (str) – Voltage or Current Source - [‘VOLTAGE’, ‘CURRENT’]
  • base (float) – Base Voltage/Current
  • peak (float) – Peak Voltage/Current when triggered
setSourceSweep(source, start, stop, points)[source]¶

Configure the SMU to Sweep a range of points.

Parameters:
  • source (str) – Voltage or Current Source - [‘VOLTAGE’, ‘CURRENT’]
  • start (float) – Starting Voltage/Current
  • stop (float) – Final Voltage/Current
  • points (int) – Number of Points
setTriggerSetup(triggerSource, number, interval, delay=0)[source]¶

Set SMU Trigger settings

Parameters:
  • triggerSource (str) – Trigger Source - [‘AINT’, ‘BUS’, ‘TIMER’, ‘INT1’, ‘INT2’, ‘LAN’, ‘EXT1’, ‘EXT2’, ‘EXT3’, ‘EXT4’, ‘EXT5’, ‘EXT6’, ‘EXT7’, ‘EXT8’, ‘EXT9’, ‘EXT10’, ‘EXT11’, ‘EXT12’, ‘EXT13’, ‘EXT14’]
  • number (int) – Number of Triggers per sequence - 1 to 100000 or 2147483647 (INF)
  • interval (float) – Timing interval in seconds - must be greater than 20E-6
  • delay (float) – Delay before first trigger in seconds
startCollector(method, interval, depth)¶

Starts a Collector thread to retrieve data at a regular interval.

Parameters:
  • method (str) – Name of the Model method to invoke
  • interval (int) – Interval in milliseconds between method invokations
  • depth (int) – Number of samples to keep
Returns:

Boolean, True if successful, False otherwise.
